page.title: 18RELIGION:WOODTON
page.content: Woodton Anglican church is in the Depwade Deanery in the Diocese of Nor- wich.Since 1926 the parish has been linked with Bedingham but in 1964 it was joined with Hempnall,Topcroft, Morningthorpe,Fritton,Hardwick & Shel- ton so it is ecclesiastically one of 8 in the Hempnall Group of parishes which in 1985 joyfully celebrated 21 years together.There are 2 full-time priests,one living in Woodton,the other in Hempnall.The staff is aug- mented by a non-stipendiary priest,an educationalist resident in Topcroft; several retired clergy;& a team of lay ministers who help with both pastoral & liturgical work.The C13 building has a nave & chancel,plus a south aisle. The tower is a typical round Norfolk one,possibly Saxon with a C14 octagonal top.A vestry was added in the 1920s;the 6 bells rehung in 1984.
